summary:
I work with logistics/freight companies looking to gain efficiency in operations to improve bottomline.
Together with a global team we enable our growth strategy. I love collaborating with businesses globally who are interested in improving their business. Identify areas of improvement where technology can bring value (being happier customers|employees, higher revenue|profitability, reduce costs|risks).

Complex processes and business operations, modelled, planned, simulated and optimised to transform an issue into a competitive advantage. Solution applications that transform businesses, solving complex puzzles that help people make the best decisions at the right time.

15 years combined experience in supply chain, logistics, IT, advanced analytics and optimisation, people management, transformation projects, B2B enterprise SW sales and strategy.

Believer in teams that make a difference; of analysis and processes -to replicate success, and of people's motivation -that spark excitement and engagement on what we do (leadership).

I love complex puzzles and this is why I have fun working Dassault Systemes, being at the forefront of technology and transformation that make an impact in the largest businesses, their customers and the environment.

About me: I was raised in tugboats & ships. Later I grew up in race-car shops building and preparing stock cars, formulas, rallies. Every day at the shop and every weekend at the racetrack. Competitiveness is in the blood, and it is also a gentlemen's sport, where preparation makes a difference. Loved races from the pits, not the stands. Then I was also involved with large machinery for construction, selling them, repairing them, driving them. 
In Uni I loved Math and computing subjects and I consider myself very lucky that I get to keep doing the same; but one of the best lessons was actually one day playing drums in a crowded auditorium: while giving your best, always remember to smile and try to have fun.

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for the total client relationship with important IBM clients in the Retail and Distribution Industry. Develop long term trust with the Customer. Successfully sell enterprise class Solutions to corporate customers. Implement account/territory planning. Develop and execute a win strategy. Ability to work at all levels with the customer and within IBM. 

Sales Leadership. Lead the account strategy in the customer set by coordinating Software Group, Systems Technology, Consulting, and Technology Services resources to maximize the opportunities. Collaborating with team members, other IBM resources and multiple levels of client executive management to define strategies and engage in ongoing negotiations to meet customer requirements. Acts as the primary contact with other IBM teams engaged in the account.

Maintain a thorough understanding of the client's industry, including industry trends, industry financial measurements, key client competitors in their industry and potential partners’ offerings, strategies and plans in order to effectively differentiate IBM’s offerings.

Promote customer awareness of IBM solutions also by taking IBM into new areas other than IT (analytics, mobile, social) with both existing and new buyers. 
Monitor that the pipeline reflects actual opportunity status on IBM systems. Remove obstacles different sales team might encounter to close a deal. Give proper voice and follow up of any customer concern or complaint.

Analyze business situations, assess risk and define innovative solutions to address client’s complex problems by engaging IBM extended teams.
(Chedraui, Office Depot, et al.)

profile_positions.description:
People manager  of 20 resources (6 employees -including 3 team leaders, and 14 subcontractors) for the country Spare Parts business (Logistics, Planning, Reutilisation, Business Controls & Finance). Responsibility on: Parts Financials (logistics contract and parts reutilisation), Operational KPIs (parts planning, parts delivery, inventory, business controls, parts returns, scrap), Contract service levels with 3PL (DHL). Focused on developing Leadership skills on the team.
Our team became the benchmark in IBM Latin America for planning, logistics and reutilisation (financial inventory, parts availability, parts delivery time, parts costs, logistics costs, parts reutilization). In 2010 I lead the divestiture of the logistics business (as 4PL) from IBM to Geodis (3PL contracts, procurement, AP, AR, SLAs, etc.).
profile_positions.title: Service Parts country manager

profile_positions.description: Working together with IBM US we were able to implement an inventory planning system that improved parts availability and analysis time. Lead the implementation for Mexico (we volunteered to be the pilot). Results were successful and we later guided implementation for the rest of LatinAmerica. During this time I was also part of the IBM Leadership Development program, preparing my skills for a future management position.
profile_positions.title: Inventory planning team lead

profile_positions.description: Lead a young team and eager team of IBMers and DHL resources to deliver all parts requests in country to improve Parts Delivery Time. Faced with the challenged of a newly signed multi-vendor services contract with a major retailer (+4,000 stores across Mexico) developed a network redesign based on operations research (linear programming) to come up with a new network of stock locations that could deliver parts under two hours >90% of the time (we were only achieving 60%). This implied growing from 6 to 32 locations. Mandatory to maintain costs flat, so rewrote the existing DHL contract we had. Key: change from flat to variable rates. Excess costs we incurred on hand carries, were now used for smaller, more dynamic stock locations. Complying with IBM security standards we opened the new stock locations by waves, and after six months achieved expected results by the model (90% ontime delivery). Costs remained flat.
profile_positions.title: Logistics & Operations team lead

profile_positions.description: Weekly planning and reordering parts replenishments to improve Parts Availability Level. The existing LatAm weekly planning process, implanted by Peru leadership, took 2-3 days -every week- from each planner. After understanding how things were done in IBM Service Parts I developed an algorithm on a spreadsheet to automatically plan more than 98% of the thousands of part numbers for weekly reordering. This algorithm identified outliers (1-2%) that needed special focus. With that I managed to shorten the same planning process to 2 hours per week. Planning accuracy remained the same. This disruptor caused controversy in the Americas team, on how we should plan.
profile_positions.title: Inventory Planning Analyst

profile_positions.description:
Mextrac was the Caterpillar licensed seller in central & south east Mexico, later acquired by Madisa. I began doing reports and updating systems part time. After a few months I was working full time, involved in the import process of machinery, spare parts delivery, inventory management, and mainly supporting machinery sales cycles (quotation, progression, systems update, contract, import, and delivery). Branch manager was also sales executive for machinery. Together we doubled our sales numbers each year. From having sold only a 416 backhoe, to selling multiple 416Cs, D9s, 120Hs and a 320D.
Also supported forklift sales, key accounts manager, and financial & administrative processes.
After 3 years I quit in order to begin University studies on Applied Math & Computing.
